disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents by not following their instructions?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: When frustrated with Church members, did you reject the unity of the Body of Christ?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I use words to belittle or mock the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

condoning.question: Did you condone a funeral where human remains were not properly handled?

to an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, leading to an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
to my family 's needs and well - being
gluttony.question: Have I allowed myself to overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable, especially when it comes to my family's needs and well-being?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over meeting the needs of my family
prodigality.question: Have I been excessively wasteful in my financial obligations, prioritizing personal indulgences over meeting the needs of my family?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: such as leisure activities or hobbies
over my financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I excessively and wastefully prioritized personal indulgences, such as leisure activities or hobbies, over my financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, during conversations at home, in social gatherings, or online?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger within my family relationships rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger against my family members rather than seeking reconciliation through forgiveness and understanding?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
